page.title: 12RIVER DEAN
page.content: The Dean flows from Bollington through our survey area.Here it is still a stream measuring about six metres wide.It winds and twists with banks about 1 metre high.In some places the banks are covered in nettles and greenery.The river is shallow and fast flowing,but on the bends it can be 1 metre deep.Its bed is made up of pebbles and sandy mud.Weeds may be found in a few places.There is some pollution.We saw a tyre,a pram and an old radio. Surrounding the river is farmland for grazing dairy cattle,growing hay, rearing ducks and keeping sheep.Near the river are 2 woods with willow, ash, oak,alder and beech.Willow is the most common. We saw no fish but noticed private fishing signs.By{Nicholas and Simon {Akerman.
